 242++F0E4 00           xX13        DB 0
 243++F0E5 00 00        XX1510      DW 0    ; x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 244++F0E7 00 00        XX1532      DW 0    ; y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 245++F0E9 00 00        XX1554      DW 0    ; x2
 246++F0EB              XX1554p1    EQU XX1554+1
 247++F0EB 00 00        XX1576      DW 0    ; y2
 248++F0ED              XX1210      EQU XX1576
 249++F0ED              XX12p1      EQU XX1210+1
 250++F0ED              XX15X1lo    EQU XX1510
 251++F0ED              XX15X1hi    EQU XX1510+1
 252++F0ED              XX15Y1lo    EQU XX1532
 253++F0ED              XX15Y1hi    EQU XX1532+1
 254++F0ED              XX15X2lo    EQU XX1554
 255++F0ED              XX15X2hi    EQU XX1554+1
 256++F0ED              XX15Y2lo    EQU XX1210
 257++F0ED              XX15Y2hi    EQU XX1210+1
 258++F0ED
 259++F0ED 00           XX12p2      DB 0    ; The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 260++F0EE 00           XX12p3      DB 0    ; The direction of slope ; + LT to BR; - TR to BL
 261++F0EF 00           XX12p4      DB 0
 262++F0F0 00           XX12p5      DB 0
 263++F0F1              Delta_x     EQU XX12p2
 264++F0F1              Delta_y     EQU XX12p4
 265++F0F1 00           Tvar        DB 0    ; The gradient of slope ; 0 if it's a shallow slope (DX > DY) ; &FF if it's a steep slope (DY > DX)
 266++F0F2                                  ; Returns:  XX15        m         x1 as an 8-bit coordinate XX15+2               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 267++F0F2 00           Qvar        DB 0
 268++F0F3 00           Rvar        DB 0    ; general purpose for calcs  Paired with S must be done this way round for SUBHeightFromY1 etc to work
 269++F0F4 00           Svar        DB 0    ; sign variable
 270++F0F5              SRvarPair   EQU Rvar
 271++F0F5 00           Xreg        DB 0
 272++F0F6 00           Yreg        DB 0
 273++F0F7              YXregPair   EQU Xreg
 274++F0F7
 275++F0F7              ;-- Name: LL28 Calculate R = 256 * A / Q
 276++F0F7              ;-- LL28+4              Skips the A >= Q check and always returns with C flag cleared, so this can be called if we know the division will work
 277++F0F7              ;-- LL31                Skips the A >= Q check and does not set the R counter, so this can be used for jumping straight into the division loop if R is already set to 254 and we know the division will work
 278++F0F7              ;   Reg mapping 6502  Z80
 279++F0F7              ;               a     a
 280++F0F7              ;               b     x
 281++F0F7              ;               c     q
 282++F0F7              ;               d     r
 283++F0F7              ;
 284++F0F7 21 F2 F0     LL28_6502:          ld      hl,Qvar                 ; CMP Q                  \ If A >= Q, then the answer will not fit in one byte,
 285++F0FA 4E                               ld      c,(hl)                  ; using c as Q var
 286++F0FB B9                               cp      c
 287++F0FC                                  FlipCarryFlag
 287++F0FC 3F          >                        ccf
 288++F0FD DA 25 F1                         jp      c, LL2_6502             ; BCS LL2                \ so jump to LL2 to return 255
 289++F100 06 FE                            ld      b,$FE                   ; LDX #%11111110         \ Set R to have bits 1-7 set, so we can rotate through 7 loop iterations, getting a 1 each time, and then we use b as Rvar
 290++F102 CB 27        LL31_6502:          sla     a                       ; ASL A                  \ Shift A to the left
 291++F104 DA 19 F1                         jp      c,LL29_6502             ; BCS LL29               \ If bit 7 of A was set, then jump straight to the subtraction
 292++F107                                  FlipCarryFlag                   ;                          If A < N, then C flag is set.
 292++F107 3F          >                        ccf
 293++F108                                  JumpIfALTNusng c, LL31_SKIPSUB_6502 ; CMP Q              \ If A < Q, skip the following subtraction
 293++F108 B9          >                        cp      c
 293++F109 DA 0E F1    >                        jp		c, LL31_SKIPSUB_6502
 294++F10C                                                                  ; BCC P%+4
 295++F10C 91                               sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
 296++F10D                                  ClearCarryFlag
 296++F10D B7          >                        or a
 297++F10E              LL31_SKIPSUB_6502:  FlipCarryFlag
 297++F10E 3F          >                        ccf
 298++F10F CB 10                            rl      b                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 299++F111 DA 02 F1                         jp      c, LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
 300++F114 78                               ld      a,b
 301++F115 32 F3 F0                         ld      (Rvar),a
 302++F118 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ R left with remainder of division
 303++F119 91           LL29_6502:          sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
 304++F11A                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to rotate into the result in R
 304++F11A 37          >                        scf
 305++F11B CB 10                            rl      b                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 306++F11D DA 02 F1                         jp      c, LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
 307++F120 78                               ld      a,b                     ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine with R containing the
 308++F121 32 F3 F0                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; .
 309++F124 C9                               ret                             ; .                      \ remainder of the division
 310++F125 3E FF        LL2_6502:           ld      a,$FF                   ; LDA #255               \ The division is very close to 1, so return the closest
 311++F127 32 F3 F0                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; STA R                  \ possible answer to 256, i.e. R = 255
 312++F12A                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; we failed so need carry flag set
 312++F12A 37          >                        scf
 313++F12B C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 314++F12C
 315++F12C 3A F5 F0     ADDXRegtoY1:        ld      a,(Xreg)                ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 316++F12F 4F                               ld      c,a
 317++F130 06 00                            ld      b,0
 318++F132 2A E7 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1532)
 319++F135                                  ClearCarryFlag
 319++F135 B7          >                        or a
 320++F136 ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 321++F138 22 E7 F0                         ld      (XX1532),hl
 322++F13B C9                               ret
 323++F13C
 324++F13C ED 4B F5 F0  ADDYXRegtoY1:       ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 325++F140 2A E7 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1532)
 326++F143                                  ClearCarryFlag
 326++F143 B7          >                        or a
 327++F144 ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 328++F146 22 E7 F0                         ld      (XX1532),hl
 329++F149 C9                               ret
 330++F14A
 331++F14A ED 4B F5 F0  ADDYXRegtoX1:       ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 332++F14E 2A E5 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1510)
 333++F151                                  ClearCarryFlag
 333++F151 B7          >                        or a
 334++F152 ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 335++F154 22 E5 F0                         ld      (XX1510),hl
 336++F157 C9                               ret
 337++F158
 338++F158 2A E7 F0     SUBBCFromY1:        ld      hl,(XX1532)             ; Set (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - BC where BC can be say screen height
 339++F15B                                  ClearCarryFlag
 339++F15B B7          >                        or a
 340++F15C ED 42                            sbc     hl,bc
 341++F15E 22 F3 F0                         ld      (SRvarPair),hl
 342++F161 C9                               ret
 343++F162
 344++F162 2A F5 F0     AddSRToYX:          ld      hl,(YXregPair)
 345++F165 ED 5B F3 F0                      ld      de,(SRvarPair)
 346++F169                                  ClearCarryFlag
 346++F169 B7          >                        or a
 347++F16A ED 5A                            adc     hl,de
 348++F16C 22 F5 F0                         ld      (YXregPair),hl
 349++F16F C9                               ret
 350++F170
 351++F170              ShiftLeftMem:       MACRO   reg
 352++F170 ~                                ld      hl,reg
 353++F170 ~                                sla     (hl)
 354++F170                                  ENDM
 355++F170
 356++F170
 357++F170 7C           ClampX:             ld      a,h
 358++F171 A7                               and     a
 359++F172 7D                               ld      a,l
 360++F173 C8                               ret     z
 361++F174 F2 79 F1                         jp      p,.Max255
 362++F177              .Min0:              ZeroA
 362++F177 AF          >                        xor a
 363++F178 C9                               ret
 364++F179 3E FF        .Max255:            ld      a,$FF
 365++F17B C9                               ret
 366++F17C
 367++F17C 7C           ClampY:             ld      a,h
 368++F17D A7                               and     a
 369++F17E CA 89 F1                         jp      z,.ClampYlo
 370++F181 F2 86 F1                         jp      p,.Max127
 371++F184              .Min0:              ZeroA
 371++F184 AF          >                        xor a
 372++F185 C9                               ret
 373++F186 3E 7F        .Max127:            ld      a,127
 374++F188 C9                               ret
 375++F189 7D           .ClampYlo:          ld      a,l
 376++F18A A7                               and     a
 377++F18B F0                               ret     p
 378++F18C 3E 7F                            ld      a,127
 379++F18E C9                               ret
 380++F18F
 381++F18F              ;-- Rountes to code:
 382++F18F              ;-- LL118
 383++F18F              ;-- LL120   Done
 384++F18F              ;-- LL129   Done
 385++F18F              ;-- LL123   Done
 386++F18F                              ; NOTE DOES ABS ONLY
 387++F18F
 388++F18F
 389++F18F                              ;--- LL118 Move along a point until on screen
 390++F18F              ; In XX1510 x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 391++F18F              ;    XX1532 y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 392++F18F              ;    XX12p2 The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 393++F18F              ;    XX12p3 The direction of slope: * Positive = top left to bottom right * Negative (bit 7 set) = top right to bottom left
 394++F18F              ;    T      The gradient of slope:* 0 if it's a shallow slope * &FF if it's a steep slope
 395++F18F              ;  Out  XX150               x1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 396++F18F              ;       XX152               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 397++F18F              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 398++F18F
 399++F18F
 400++F18F              ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 401++F18F              ;--  Calculate the following:
 402++F18F              ;--   * If T = 0, this is a shallow slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 403++F18F              ;--   * If T <> 0, this is a steep slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 404++F18F              ;-- giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 405++F18F              ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 406++F18F 3A E5 F0     LL120_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510)              ;LDA XX15               \ Set R = x1_lo
 407++F192 32 F3 F0                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 408++F195 CD 41 F2                         call    LL129_6502              ;JSR LL129              \ Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2 = line gradient, A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction  (S R) = |S R|
 409++F198 F5                               push    af                      ;PHA                    \ Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 410++F199              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    push    af                      ;LDX T                  \ If T is non-zero, then it's a steep slope, so jump
 411++F199 3A F1 F0                         ld      a,(Tvar)                ; .
 412++F19C 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;. REDUNDANT REMOVE IN OPTIMISATION
 413++F19F A7                               and     a                       ;BNE LL121              \ down to LL121 to calculate this instead (Y X) = (S R) / Q
 414++F1A0              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    pop     af                      ;.                      (recover teh saved A before the cp)
 415++F1A0 20 48                            jr      nz,LL121_6502           ;.
 416++F1A2              ;..   (Y X) = (S R) * Q - must be ABS, sign determined by opposite of the sign of the value on top of stack
 417++F1A2              LL122_6502:         ZeroA                           ;LDA #0                 \ Set A = 0
 417++F1A2 AF          >                        xor a
 418++F1A3                          IFDEF DEBUG_LL122_DIRECT
 419++F1A3 ~                                DISPLAY "DIRECT CALL TO LL122 so dummy push a to stack with 0"
 420++F1A3 ~                                push    af
 421++F1A3                          ENDIF
 422++F1A3 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;TAX                    \ Set (Y X) = 0 so we can start building the answer here
 423++F1A6 32 F6 F0                         ld      (Yreg),a                ;TAY
 424++F1A9 21 F4 F0                         ld      hl,Svar
 425++F1AC ED 4B F3 F0                      ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;LSR S                  \ Shift (S R) to the right, so we extract bit 0 of (S R)
 426++F1B0                                  ShiftBCRight1                   ;ROR R                  \ into the C flag
 426++F1B0 CB 38       >			   srl b
 426++F1B2 CB 19       >			   rr  c
 427++F1B4 ED 43 F3 F0                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc
 428++F1B8 21 F2 F0                         ld      hl, Qvar                ;ASL Q                  \ Shift Q to the left, catching bit 7 in the C flag
 429++F1BB CB 26                            sla     (hl)                    ;.
 430++F1BD 30 03                            jr      nc, LL126_6502          ;BCC LL126              \ If C (i.e. the next bit from Q) is clear, do not do
 431++F1BF                                                                  ;                         the addition for this bit of Q, and instead skip to LL126 to just do the shifts
 432++F1BF CD 62 F1     LL125_6502:         call    AddSRToYX               ;TXA                    \ Set (Y X) = (Y X) + (S R)  starting with the low bytes And then doing the high bytes
 433++F1C2 ED 4B F3 F0  LL126_6502:         ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;LSR S                  \ Shift (S R) to the right
 434++F1C6                                  ShiftBCRight1                   ;ROR R
 434++F1C6 CB 38       >			   srl b
 434++F1C8 CB 19       >			   rr  c
 435++F1CA ED 43 F3 F0                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc          ;.
 436++F1CE 21 F2 F0                         ld      hl, Qvar                ;ASL Q                  \ Shift Q to the left, catching bit 7 in the C flag
 437++F1D1 CB 26                            sla     (hl)                    ;.
 438++F1D3 38 EA                            jr      c,LL125_6502            ;BCS LL125              \ If C (i.e. the next bit from Q) is set, loop back to LL125 to do the addition for this bit of Q
 439++F1D5 20 EB                            jr      nz,LL126_6502           ;BNE LL126              \ If Q has not yet run out of set bits, loop back to LL126 to do the "shift" part of shift-and-add until we have done additions for all the set bits in Q, to give us our multiplication result
 440++F1D7 F1                               pop     af                      ;PLA                    \ Restore A, which we calculated above, from the stack
 441++F1D8 A7                               and     a                       ;BPL LL133              \ If A is positive jump to LL133 to negate (Y X) and
 442++F1D9 F2 32 F2                         jp      p,LL133_6502            ;.
 443++F1DC              ;.. return from the subroutine using a tail call
 444++F1DC C9                               ret                             ;RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 445++F1DD
 446++F1DD              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 447++F1DD              ;-- Calculate the following:
 448++F1DD              ;--         * If T = 0, this is a shallow slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (does not use X1lo but directly SR)
 449++F1DD              ;--         * If T <> 0, this is a steep slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2  (does not use X1lo but directly SR)
 450++F1DD              ;--             giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 451++F1DD CD 41 F2     LL123_6502:         call    LL129_6502              ;JSR LL129              \ Call LL129 to do the following   Q = XX12+2   = line gradient
 452++F1E0 F5                               push    af                      ;PHA                    \ Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 453++F1E1              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    push    af                      ;LDX T                  \ If T is non-zero, then it's a steep slope, so jump up
 454++F1E1 3A F1 F0                         ld      a,(Tvar)                ; .
 455++F1E4 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;BNE LL122              \ to LL122 to calculate this instead:
 456++F1E7 A7                               and     a                       ;.
 457++F1E8              ;  DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    pop     af                      ;.
 458++F1E8 20 B8                            jr      nz,LL122_6502           ;.
 459++F1EA              ;--  The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2
 460++F1EA 3E FF        LL121_6502:         ld      a,$FF                   ;LDA #%11111111         \ Set Y = %11111111
 461++F1EC 32 F6 F0                         ld      (Yreg),a                ;TAY
 462++F1EF CB 27                            sla     a                       ;ASL A                  \ Set X = %11111110
 463++F1F1 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;TAX
 464++F1F4              ;--  This sets (Y X) = %1111111111111110, so we can rotate through 15 loop iterations, getting a 1 each time, and then getting a 0 on the 16th iteration... and we can also use it to catch our result bits into bit 0 each time
 465++F1F4 ED 4B F3 F0  LL130_6502:         ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;ASL R                  \ Shift (S R) to the left
 466++F1F8                                  ShiftBCLeft1                    ;.
 466++F1F8 CB 21       >			   sla c
 466++F1FA CB 10       >			   rl  b
 467++F1FC ED 43 F3 F0                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc          ;ROL S
 468++F200 3A F4 F0                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ Set A = S
 469++F203 38 07                            jr      c, LL131_6502           ;BCS LL131              \ If bit 7 of S was set, then jump straight to the subtraction
 470++F205 21 F2 F0                         ld      hl,Qvar                 ;CMP Q                  \ If A < Q (i.e. S < Q), skip the following subtractions
 471++F208 BE                               cp      (hl)
 472++F209                                  FlipCarryFlag                   ; note flip carry flag here to simulate 6502 operation
 472++F209 3F          >                        ccf
 473++F20A 30 12                            jr      nc,LL132A_6502          ;BCC LL132  (NOTE Carry flag reversed in Z80 for CP)
 474++F20C              LL131_6502:         FlipCarryFlag                   ;flip carry to make it act like a 6502 borrow
 474++F20C 3F          >                        ccf
 475++F20D 9E                               sbc     (hl)                    ;SBC Q                  \ A >= Q (i.e. S >= Q) so set:
 476++F20E 32 F4 F0                         ld      (Svar),a                ;STA S
 477++F211 3A F3 F0                         ld      a,(Rvar)                ;LDA R                  \ And then doing the high bytes
 478++F214                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ;\   S = (A R) - Q  = (S R) - Q starting with the low bytes (we know the C flag is set so the subtraction will be correct)
 478++F214 B7          >                        or a
 479++F215 DE 00                            sbc     0                       ;SBC #0
 480++F217 32 F3 F0                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 481++F21A                                  SetCarryFlag                    ;SEC                    \ Set the C flag to rotate into the result in (Y X)
 481++F21A 37          >                        scf
 482++F21B C3 1F F2                         jp      LL132_6502              ;added so that we can do a 6502 style carry above
 483++F21E 00           LL132A_6502:        nop; FlipCarryFlag
 484++F21F ED 4B F5 F0  LL132_6502:         ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Rotate the counter in (Y X) to the left, and catch the
 485++F223                                  RollBCLeft1                     ; ROL A                  \ result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't
 485++F223 CB 11       >               rl  c
 485++F225 CB 10       >               rl  b
 486++F227 ED 43 F5 F0                      ld      (YXregPair),bc          ; TAX                    \ do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 487++F22B 38 C7                            jr      c, LL130_6502           ; BCS LL130              \ If we still have set bits in (Y X), loop back to LL130 to do the next iteration of 15, until we have done the whole division
 488++F22D                          IFDEF DEBUG_LL121_DIRECT
 489++F22D ~                                DISPLAY "DIRECT CALL TO LL121 so dummy push"
 490++F22D ~                                push    af
 491++F22D                          ENDIF
 492++F22D F1                               pop     af                      ; PLA                    \ Restore A, which we calculated above, from the stack
 493++F22E A7                               and     a                       ; BMI LL128              \ If A is negative jump to LL128 to return from the
 494++F22F FA 40 F2                         jp      m, LL128_6502           ; .                      \ subroutine with (Y X) as is
 495++F232 ED 4B F5 F0  LL133_6502:         ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; TXA                    \ Otherwise negate (Y X) using two's complement by first
 496++F236                                  macronegate16bc                 ; EOR #%11111111         \ setting the low byte to ~X + 1
 496++F236 AF          >					xor 	a
 496++F237 91          >                    sub 	c
 496++F238 4F          >                    ld 		c,a
 496++F239 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 496++F23A 90          >                    sub 	b
 496++F23B 47          >                    ld 		b,a
 497++F23C ED 43 F5 F0                      ld      (YXregPair),bc          ; ADC #1                 \ The addition works as we know the C flag is clear from\ when we passed through the BCS above
 498++F240 C9           LL128_6502:         ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 499++F241              ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 500++F241              ;..  Do the following, in this order: Q = XX12+2 A = S EOR XX12+3 (S R) = |S R|
 501++F241              ;..  This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 502++F241 F5           LL129_6502:         push    af                      ;LDX XX12+2             \ Set Q = XX12+2
 503++F242 3A ED F0                         ld      a,(XX12p2)              ;.
 504++F245 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;.
 505++F248 32 F2 F0                         ld      (Qvar),a                ;STX Q
 506++F24B F1                               pop     af                      ;.
 507++F24C 3A F4 F0                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ If S is positive, jump to LL127
 508++F24F A7                               and     a                       ;BPL LL127
 509++F250 F2 68 F2                         jp      p,LL127_6502            ;.
 510++F253                                  ZeroA                           ;.LDA #0                \ Otherwise set R = -R
 510++F253 AF          >                        xor a
 511++F254                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ;SEC
 511++F254 B7          >                        or a
 512++F255 21 F3 F0                         ld      hl, Rvar                ;SBC R
 513++F258 9E                               sbc     (hl)                    ;.
 514++F259 32 F3 F0                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 515++F25C 3A F4 F0                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ Push S onto the stack
 516++F25F F5                               push    af                      ;PHA
 517++F260 EE FF                            xor     $FF                     ;EOR #%11111111         \ Set S = ~S + 1 + C  ?? is this all just doing |Svar|?
 518++F262 CE 00                            adc     0                       ;ADC #0
 519++F264 32 F4 F0                         ld      (Svar),a                ;STA S
 520++F267 F1                               pop     af                      ;PLA                    \ Pull the original, negative S from the stack into A
 521++F268 21 EE F0     LL127_6502:         ld      hl,XX12p3               ;EOR XX12+3             \ Set A = original argument S EOR'd with XX12+3
 522++F26B AE                               xor     (hl)                    ;.
 523++F26C C9                               ret                             ;RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 524++F26D              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 525++F26D              ;--- LL118 Move along a point until on screen
 526++F26D              ; In XX1510 x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 527++F26D              ;    XX1532 y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 528++F26D              ;    XX12p2 The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 529++F26D              ;    XX12p3 The direction of slope: * Positive = top left to bottom right * Negative (bit 7 set) = top right to bottom left
 530++F26D              ;    T      The gradient of slope:* 0 if it's a shallow slope * &FF if it's a steep slope
 531++F26D              ;  Out  XX150               x1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 532++F26D              ;       XX152               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 533++F26D              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 534++F26D
 535++F26D 3A E6 F0     LL118_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the
 536++F270 A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL119              \ .
 537++F271 F2 8E F2                         jp      p, LL119_6502           ;                        \ following
 538++F274 32 F4 F0     .X1Negative:        ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 539++F277 CD 8F F1                         call    LL120_6502              ; Call LL120 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 540++F27A                                                                  ;                            (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 541++F27A                                                                  ; with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 542++F27A CD 3C F1                         call    ADDYXRegtoY1             ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 543++F27D 22 E7 F0                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; .
 544++F280 21 00 00                         ld      hl,0                    ; Set x1 = 0
 545++F283 22 E5 F0                         ld      (XX1510),hl             ; .
 546++F286 3E 00                            ld      a,0                     ; set 0 up for replacemetn of the TAX and BEQ bit
 547++F288 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; TAX                    \ Set X = 0 so the next BEQ becomes a jmp but we will do it anyway in next line
 548++F28B C3 A4 F2                         jp      LL134_6502              ; just do the jump to LL134 rather than setting to equal flag and then jumping
 549++F28E              ;-- Entering LL119 a will always be the value of X1 Hi byte
 550++F28E CA A4 F2     LL119_6502:         jp      z,LL134_6502            ; BEQ LL134              \ x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen
 551++F291                                                                  ;                        \ (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 552++F291 32 F4 F0                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off
 553++F294 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEC S                  \ the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 554++F295 32 F4 F0                         ld      (Svar),a                ;
 555++F298 CD 8F F1                         call    LL120_6502              ; JSR LL120              \ Call LL120 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 556++F29B                                                                  ;                        \                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 557++F29B                                                                  ;                        \ with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 558++F29B CD 3C F1                         call    ADDYXRegtoY1             ; TXA                    \ Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 559++F29E 21 FF 00                         ld      hl,255                  ; LDX #255               \ Set x1 = 255
 560++F2A1 22 E5 F0                         ld      (XX1510),hl             ; STX XX15 ;INX; STX XX15+1
 561++F2A4              ;--  We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on  screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for the  y-coordinate
 562++F2A4 3A E8 F0     LL134_6502:         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip
 563++F2A7 A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL135              \ the following
 564++F2A8 F2 C0 F2                         jp      p, LL135_6502           ; .
 565++F2AB 32 F4 F0                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 566++F2AE 3A E7 F0                         ld      a, (XX1532)             ; LDA XX15+2             \ Set R = y1_lo
 567++F2B1 32 F3 F0                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; STA R
 568++F2B4 CD DD F1                         call    LL123_6502              ; JSR LL123              \ Call LL123 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0 = y1 / gradient
 569++F2B7                                                                  ;                        \                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 570++F2B7                                                                  ;                         with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 571++F2B7 CD 4A F1                         call    ADDYXRegtoX1            ; TXA                    \ Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 572++F2BA 21 00 00                         ld      hl,0                    ; LDA #0                 \ Set y1 = 0
 573++F2BD 22 E7 F0                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; STA XX15+2, XX15+3
 574++F2C0 01 80 00     LL135_6502:         ld      bc,128                  ; LDA XX15+2             \ Set (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - screen height
 575++F2C3 CD 58 F1                         call    SUBBCFromY1             ; .                      \ .
 576++F2C6 38 0C                            jr      c, LL136_6502           ; BCC LL136              \ If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < screen height, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136
 577++F2C8                                                                  ;                        \ to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 578++F2C8              ;;-   If we get here then y1 >= screen height, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 579++F2C8 CD DD F1     LL139_6502:         call    LL123_6502              ; JSR LL123              \ Call LL123 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = (y1 - screen height) / gradient
 580++F2CB                                                                  ;                        \                            (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (y1 - screen height) * gradient
 581++F2CB                                                                  ;                          with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 582++F2CB CD 4A F1                         call    ADDYXRegtoX1            ; TXA                    \ Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 583++F2CE 21 7F 00                         ld      hl, 127                 ; LDA #Y*2-1             \ Set y1 = 2 * #Y - 1. The constant #Y is 96, the y-coordinate of the mid-point of the space view (or in our case 127)
 584++F2D1 22 E7 F0                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; STA XX15+3             \ pixel row of the space view
 585++F2D4 C9           LL136_6502:         ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 586++F2D5              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 587++F2D5              ;-- LL145 LINE CLIP
 588++F2D5              ;-- OPTISIATIONS - VERTICAL HORZONTAL POINT |DX| = |DY| (and all the veriants for +/-)
 589++F2D5              ;-- This routine clips the line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) so it fits on-screen, or returns an error if it can't be clipped to fit. The arguments are 16-bit coordinates, and the clipped line is returned using 8-bit screen coordinates.
 590++F2D5              ;-- This part sets XX13 to reflect which of the two points are on-screen and off-screen.
 591++F2D5              ;-- IN  : XX15(1 0) x1 XX15(3 2) y1 XX15(5 4) x2 XX12(1 0) y2
 592++F2D5              ;-- OUT : (X1, Y1), (X2, Y2) Screen coordinate C flag  Clear if the clipped line fits on-screen, set if itdoesn't
 593++F2D5              ;         XX13 The state of the original coordinates on-screen:* 0   = (x2, y2) on-screen* 95(64)  = (x1, y1) on-screen,  (x2, y2) off-screen* 191(128) = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) off-screen
 594++F2D5              ;              So XX13 is non-zero if the end of the line was clipped,meaning the next line sent to BLINE can't join onto the end but has to start a new segment
 595++F2D5              ;         SWAP The swap status of the returned coordinates:* &FF if we swapped the values of (x1, y1) and(x2, y2) as part of the clipping process* 0 if the coordinates are still in the same order
 596++F2D5              ; TODO treat horizonal/vert and single pixel as special cases
 597++F2D5              LL145_6502:         ZeroA                           ; LDA #0                 \ Set SWAP = 0
 597++F2D5 AF          >                        xor a
 598++F2D6 32 18 C9                         ld      (SWAP),a                ; STA SWAP
 599++F2D9 3A EA F0                         ld      a,(XX1554+1)            ; LDA XX15+5             \ Set A = x2_hi (use b as a substibute for a)
 600++F2DC 47                               ld      b,a                     ; .
 601++F2DD              ; Note that as we are interested in the sign of XX113 then this needs to be >= 128 or < 128 or 0, we will use 191 as per bbc for now
 602++F2DD              ; for the screen coord we will use 127 though, we use c as a temporay X register
 603++F2DD 3E BF        LL147_6502:         ld      a,191                   ; LDX #Y*2-1             \ Set X = #Y * 2 - 1. The constant #Y is 96, the y-coordinate of the mid-point of the space view, so this sets Y2 to 191, the y-coordinate of the bottom pixel row of the space view
 604++F2DF 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; .
 605++F2E2              ;                    ld      a,127
 606++F2E2              ;                    ld      c,a
 607++F2E2 78           .CheckX2Y2High:     ld      a,b                     ; ORA XX12+1             \ If one or both of x2_hi and y2_hi are non-zero, jump
 608++F2E3 21 EC F0                         ld      hl,XX12p1               ; .
 609++F2E6 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 610++F2E7 C2 F7 F2                         jp      nz,LL107_6502           ; BNE LL107              \ to LL107 to skip the following, leaving X at 191
 611++F2EA 3E 7F        .CheckY2Lo:         ld      a,127 ;,c               ; get back the temporary x reg from c
 612++F2EC 21 EB F0                         ld      hl,XX1210               ; CPX XX12               \ If y2_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen (a is being used as X at this point still)
 613++F2EF BE                               cp      (hl)                    ; .
 614++F2F0 DA F7 F2                         jp      c,LL107_6502            ; BCC LL107              \ then (x2, y2) is off the bottom of the screen, so skip the following instruction, leaving X at 127
 615++F2F3                                  ZeroA                           ; LDX #0                 \ Set X = 0
 615++F2F3 AF          >                        xor a
 616++F2F4 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a
 617++F2F7 3A F5 F0     LL107_6502:         ld      a,(Xreg)                ; STX XX13               \ Set XX13 = X, so we have * XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen* XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lois off the bottom of the screen
 618++F2FA 32 8A 7E                         ld      (XX13),a                ; now c is released as a temporary x reg
 619++F2FD 3A E6 F0                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If one or both of x1_hi and y1_hi are non-zero, jump
 620++F300 21 E8 F0                         ld      hl,XX1532+1             ; ORA XX15+3             \ to LL83
 621++F303 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 622++F304 C2 44 F3                         jp      nz,LL83_6502            ; BNE LL83
 623++F307              ; DEBUG SIMPLIFIED CODE, now we just compare y1 lo > 127
 624++F307 3A E7 F0                         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; If y1_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen (If A >= N, then C flag is reset.) ;ld      a,127                   ; LDA #Y*2-1             \ If y1_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen (If A >= N, then C flag is reset.)
 625++F30A 26 7F                            ld      h,127                   ; then (x1, y1) is off the bottom of the screen, so jump                                 ;ld      hl,XX1532               ; CMP XX15+2             \ then (x1, y1) is off the bottom of the screen, so jump
 626++F30C BC                               cp      h                       ; to LL83                                                                                ;cp      (hl)                    ; .                      \ to LL83
 627++F30D D2 44 F3                         jp      nc, LL83_6502         ; BCC LL83               \ . (y1 > 127 jump, i.e. 127 <= y1 )
 628++F310 3A 8A 7E                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen. If XX13 is non-zero, i.e. (x2, y2) is off-screen, jump
 629++F313 A7                               and     a                       ; BNE LL108              \ to LL108 to halve it before continuing at LL83
 630++F314 C2 3F F3                         jp      nz,LL108_6502
 631++F317              ; If we get here, the high bytes are all zero, which means the x-coordinates are < 256 and therefore fit on screen, and neither coordinate is off the bottom of the screen. That means both coordinates are already on
 632++F317              ; screen, so we don't need to do any clipping, all weneed to do is move the low bytes into (X1, Y1) and X2, Y2) and return
 633++F317              ; X1 = XX15 (10)  Y1 = XX15+1 X2 = XX15+2 Y2 = XX15+3
 634++F317                  DEFINE CLAMPINGEXTREMES
 635++F317              LL146_6502: IFDEF CLAMPINGEXTREMES
 636++F317 2A E5 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1510)             ;  Save X1 to XX1510
 637++F31A CD 70 F1                         call    ClampX
 638++F31D 32 E5 F0                         ld      (XX1510),a
 639++F320                          ENDIF
 640++F320 2A E7 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1532)             ;  hl = y1
 641++F323 CD 7C F1                         call    ClampY
 642++F326 32 E6 F0                         ld      (XX1510+1),a            ;  XX1510... = [X1][Y1]
 643++F329
 644++F329 2A E9 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1554)             ;  de = x2
 645++F32C CD 70 F1                         call    ClampX
 646++F32F 32 E7 F0                         ld      (XX1510+2),a            ;  XX1510... = [X1][Y1][X2]
 647++F332
 648++F332 2A EB F0                         ld      hl,(XX1576)             ;  bc = y2
 649++F335 CD 7C F1                         call    ClampY
 650++F338 32 E8 F0                         ld      (XX1510+3),a            ;  XX1510... = [X1][Y1][X2][Y2]
 651++F33B
 652++F33B                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; CLC                    \ Clear the C flag as the clipped line fits on-screen
 652++F33B B7          >                        or a
 653++F33C C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 654++F33D              LL109_6502:         SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to indicate the clipped line does not fit on-screen
 654++F33D 37          >                        scf
 655++F33E C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 656++F33F 21 8A 7E     LL108_6502:         ld      hl,XX13                 ; LSR XX13               \ If we get here then (x2, y2) is off-screen and XX13 is
 657++F342 CB 3E                            srl     (hl)                    ;                        \ 191, (128)  so shift XX13 right to halve it to 95 (64)
 658++F344              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 659++F344              ;-- LL145 (Part 2 of 4)
 660++F344 3A 8A 7E     LL83_6502:          ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 < 128 then only one of the points is on-screen
 661++F347 A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL115              \ so jump down to LL115 to skip the checks of whether
 662++F348 F2 94 F3                         jp      p,LL115_6502            ;                        \ both points are in the strips to the right or bottom of the screen
 663++F34B              ;-- If we get here, both points are off-screen
 664++F34B 3A E6 F0                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109
 665++F34E 21 EA F0                         ld      hl,XX1554+1             ; AND XX15+5             \ to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as
 666++F351 A6                               and     (hl)
 667++F352 FA 3D F3                         jp      m, LL109_6502           ; BMI LL109              \ the entire line is above the top of the screen
 668++F355 3A E8 F0                         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109
 669++F358 21 EC F0                         ld      hl,XX1576+1             ; AND XX12+1             \ to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as
 670++F35B A6                               and     (hl)                    ; BMI LL109              \ the entire line is to the left of the screen
 671++F35C FA 3D F3                         jp      m,LL109_6502            ; .
 672++F35F 3A E6 F0                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDX XX15+1             \ Set A = X = x1_hi - 1
 673++F362 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEX
 674++F363 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; TXA
 675++F366 F5                               push    af                      ; LDX XX15+5     SP+1    \ Set XX12+2 = x2_hi - 1, we need to save a register first
 676++F367 3A EA F0                         ld      a,(XX1554+1)            ; .
 677++F36A 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEX
 678++F36B 32 F5 F0                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; STX XX12+2
 679++F36E F1                               pop     af                      ; .              SP+0    restore a register
 680++F36F 21 EC F0                         ld      hl,XX1576+1             ; ORA XX12+2             \ If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set,
 681++F372 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 682++F373 F2 3D F3                         jp      p, LL109_6502           ; BPL LL109              \ jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 683++F376              ; for this bit, while z80 uses carry the opposite way to 6502, 6502 uses borrow, in effect inverting the flip
 684++F376              ;NOTEFOUND A PATH WHERE IT DOES NOT DO THIS CHECK e.g. 90 B2 8D A2
 685++F376 3A E7 F0     LL83_DEBUG:         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; LDA XX15+2             \ If y1_lo < y-coordinate of screen bottom, clear the C
 686++F379 FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ flag, otherwise set it (NOTE FLIPPED IN z80)
 687++F37B 3A E8 F0                         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ Set XX12+2 = y1_hi - (1 - C), so:
 688++F37E              ;                    FlipCarryFlag                   ; as 6502 uses borrow in subtracts we flip for SBC as z80 CP does opposite too, if A < N carry set so flip
 689++F37E DE 00                            sbc     0                       ; SBC #0                 \ .
 690++F380 32 ED F0                         ld      (XX12p2),a              ; STA XX12+2             \  * Set XX12+2 = y1_hi - 1 if y1_lo is on-screen * Set XX12+2 = y1_hi  otherwise We do this subtraction because we are only interested
 691++F383 3A EB F0                         ld      a,(XX1576)              ; LDA XX12               \ If y2_lo < y-coordinate of screen bottom, clear the C
 692++F386 FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ flag, otherwise set it
 693++F388 3A EC F0                         ld      a,(XX1576+1)            ; LDA XX12+1             \ Set XX12+2 = y2_hi - (1 - C), so:
 694++F38B              ;                    FlipCarryFlag
 695++F38B DE 00                            sbc     0                       ; SBC #0                   * Set XX12+1 = y2_hi - 1 if y2_lo is on-screen  * Set XX12+1 = y2_hi     otherwise
 696++F38D 21 ED F0                         ld      hl,XX12p2               ; ORA XX12+2             \ If neither XX12+1 or XX12+2 have bit 7 set, jump to
 697++F390 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 698++F391 F2 3D F3                         jp      p,LL109_6502            ; BPL LL109              \ LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 699++F394              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 700++F394              ;-- LL145 (Part 3 of 4) Summary: Clip line: Calculate the line's gradient
 701++F394 3A F6 F0     LL115_6502:         ld      a,(Yreg)                ; TYA                    \ Store Y on the stack so we can preserve it through the call to this routine
 702++F397 F5                               push    af                      ; PHA            SP+1    \ call to this subroutine
 703++F398 2A E9 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1554)             ; LDA XX15+4             \ Set XX12+2 = x2_lo - x1_lo
 704++F39B ED 5B E5 F0                      ld      de,(XX1510)             ; LDA XX15+5             \ Set XX12+3 = x2_hi - x1_hi
 705++F39F                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; SBC XX15+1
 705++F39F B7          >                        or a
 706++F3A0 ED 52                            sbc     hl,de                   ; .
 707++F3A2 22 BF F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl            ; .
 708++F3A5 2A EB F0                         ld      hl,(XX1576)             ; LDA XX12               \ Set XX12+4 = y2_lo - y1_lo
 709++F3A8 ED 5B E7 F0                      ld      de,(XX1532)             ;
 710++F3AC                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; SBC XX15+2
 710++F3AC B7          >                        or a
 711++F3AD ED 52                            sbc     hl,de                   ; .
 712++F3AF 22 C1 F5                         ld      (delta_y),hl            ; .
 713++F3B2              ; So we now have:  delta_x in XX12(3 2)  delta_y in XX12(5 4) where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 714++F3B2 3A C2 F5                         ld      a,(delta_y+1)           ; EOR XX12+3             \ Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so
 715++F3B5 21 C0 F5                         ld      hl,delta_x+1
 716++F3B8 AE                               xor     (hl)
 717++F3B9 32 F4 F0                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs (perhaps we should do bit 7 mask ?????????
 718++F3BC 2A C1 F5                         ld      hl,(delta_y)            ; LDA XX12+5             \ If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip
 719++F3BF 7C                               ld      a,h
 720++F3C0 A7                               and     a
 721++F3C1 F2 CD F3                         jp      p, LL110_6502           ; BPL LL110              \ the following
 722++F3C4                                  NegHL                           ; LDA #0                 \ Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it
 722++F3C4 AF          >                    xor a
 722++F3C5 95          >                    sub l
 722++F3C6 6F          >                    ld l,a
 722++F3C7 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 722++F3C8 94          >                    sub h
 722++F3C9 67          >                    ld h,a
 723++F3CA 22 C1 F5                         ld      (delta_y),hl            ; positive, starting with the low bytes
 724++F3CD 2A BF F5     LL110_6502:         ld      hl,(delta_x)            ; LDA XX12+3             \ If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL111 to skip
 725++F3D0 7C                               ld      a,h                     ; BPL LL111              \ the following
 726++F3D1 A7                               and     a                       ; .
 727++F3D2 F2 DE F3                         jp      p,LL111_6502            ; .
 728++F3D5                                  NegHL                           ; SEC                    \ Otherwise flip the sign of delta_x to make it
 728++F3D5 AF          >                    xor a
 728++F3D6 95          >                    sub l
 728++F3D7 6F          >                    ld l,a
 728++F3D8 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 728++F3D9 94          >                    sub h
 728++F3DA 67          >                    ld h,a
 729++F3DB 22 BF F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl            ; LDA #0                 \ positive, starting with the low bytes
 730++F3DE              ;--  We now keep halving |delta_x| and |delta_y| until both of them have zero in their high bytes
 731++F3DE 2A BF F5     LL111_6502:         ld      hl,(delta_x)
 732++F3E1 ED 5B C1 F5                      ld      de,(delta_y)
 733++F3E5 7C                               ld      a,h                     ; TAX                    \ If |delta_x_hi| is non-zero, skip the following
 734++F3E6 B2                               or      d                       ; BNE LL112
 735++F3E7 CA FC F3                         jp      z,LL113_6502            ; LDX XX12+5             \ If |delta_y_hi| = 0, jump down to LL113 (as both |delta_x_hi| and |delta_y_hi| are 0)
 736++F3EA              LL112_6502:         ShiftHLRight1                   ; LSR A                  \ Halve the value of delta_x in (A XX12+2)
 736++F3EA CB 3C       >			   srl h
 736++F3EC CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 737++F3EE                                  ShiftDERight1                   ; LSR XX12+5             \ Halve the value of delta_y XX12(5 4)
 737++F3EE CB 3A       >			   srl d
 737++F3F0 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 738++F3F2 22 BF F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl
 739++F3F5 ED 53 C1 F5                      ld      (delta_y),de            ; write them back so we don't end up in an infinite loop
 740++F3F9 C3 DE F3                         jp  LL111_6502                  ; JMP LL111              \ Loop back to LL111
 741++F3FC              ;-- By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero
 742++F3FC              LL113_6502:         ZeroA                           ; STX T                  \ We know that X = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ  above, so this sets T = 0
 742++F3FC AF          >                        xor a
 743++F3FD 32 F1 F0                         ld  (Tvar),a
 744++F400 3A BF F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; LDA XX12+2             \ If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more
 745++F403 21 C1 F5                         ld      hl,delta_y              ; CMP XX12+4             \ vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 746++F406 BE                               cp      (hl)
 747++F407 DA 19 F4                         jp      c, LL114_6502           ; BCC LL114              ; if delta y > delta x then its a steep slope so we do 256*dy/dx
 748++F40A              ;-- If we get here then our line is more horizontal than vertical, so it is a shallow slope
 749++F40A 3A BF F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; STA Q                  \ Set Q = delta_x_lo
 750++F40D 32 F2 F0                         ld      (Qvar),a                ; .
 751++F410 3A C1 F5                         ld      a,(delta_y)             ; LDA XX12+4             \ Set A = delta_y_lo
 752++F413 CD F7 F0                         call    LL28_6502               ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 753++F416 C3 2A F4                         jp      LL116_6502              ; JMP LL116              \ Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 754++F419              ;-- If we get here then our line is more vertical than horizontal, so it is a steep slope
 755++F419 3A C1 F5     LL114_6502:         ld      a,(delta_y)             ; LDA XX12+4             \ Set Q = delta_y_lo
 756++F41C 32 F2 F0                         ld      (Qvar),a                ; STA Q
 757++F41F 3A BF F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; LDA XX12+2             \ Set A = delta_x_lo
 758++F422 CD F7 F0                         call    LL28_6502               ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 759++F425 3E FF                            ld      a,$FF                   ; DEC T                  \ T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF when our
 760++F427 32 F1 F0                         ld      (Tvar),a                ;                        \ line is steep
 761++F42A              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 762++F42A              ;--- LL116 This part sets things up to call the routine in LL188, which does the actual clipping.
 763++F42A              ;--  If we get here, then R has been set to the gradient of the line (x1, y1) to(x2, y2), with T indicating the gradient of slope: * 0   = shallow slope (more horizontal than vertical)
 764++F42A              ;--                                                                                                                                * &FF = steep slope (more vertical than horizontal)
 765++F42A              ;-- XX13 has been set as follows: * 0   = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) on-screen * 95(64)  = (x1, y1) on-screen,  (x2, y2) off-screen * 191(128) = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) off-screen
 766++F42A 3A F3 F0     LL116_6502:         ld      a,(Rvar)                ; LDA R                  \ Store the gradient in XX12+2
 767++F42D 32 ED F0                         ld      (XX12p2),a              ; STA XX12+2
 768++F430 3A F4 F0                         ld      a,(Svar)                ; LDA S                  \ Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means
 769++F433 32 EE F0                         ld      (XX12p3),a              ; STA XX12+3             \ top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left
 770++F436 3A 8A 7E                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 771++F439 FE 00                            cp      0                       ; BEQ LL138
 772++F43B CA 41 F4                         jp      z,LL138_6502            ; .
 773++F43E F2 5D F4                         jp      p, LLX117_6502          ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95 (64) as 128 would be negative). This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump
 774++F441              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 775++F441 CD 6D F2     LL138_6502:         call    LL118_6502              ; JSR LL118              \ Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 776++F444 3A 8A 7E                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to
 777++F447 A7                               and     a
 778++F448 F2 80 F4                         jp      p,LL124_6502            ; BPL LL124              \ LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 779++F44B              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 191 (128) (both coordinates areoff-screen)
 780++F44B 3A E6 F0     LL117_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 781++F44E 21 E8 F0                         ld      hl,XX1532+1             ; ORA XX15+3             \ LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 782++F451 B6                               or      (hl)
 783++F452 C2 88 F4                         jp      nz, LL137_6502          ; BNE LL137              \ set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 784++F455 3A E7 F0                         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; LDA XX15+2             \ If y1_lo > y-coordinate of the bottom of the screen
 785++F458 FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ jump to LL137 to return from the subroutine with the
 786++F45A D2 88 F4                         jp      nc, LL137_6502          ; BCS LL137              \ C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 787++F45D              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 788++F45D 2A E5 F0     LLX117_6502:        ld      hl,(XX1510)             ; LDX XX15               \ Swap x1_lo = x2_lo
 789++F460 ED 5B E9 F0                      ld      de,(XX1554)
 790++F464 ED 53 E5 F0                      ld      (XX1510),de
 791++F468 22 E9 F0                         ld      (XX1554),hl
 792++F46B 2A E7 F0                         ld      hl,(XX1532)             ; LDX XX15+2             \ Swap y1_lo = y2_lo
 793++F46E ED 5B EB F0                      ld      de,(XX1576)
 794++F472 ED 53 E7 F0                      ld      (XX1532),de
 795++F476 22 EB F0                         ld      (XX1576),hl
 796++F479 CD 6D F2                         call    LL118_6502              ; JSR LL118              \ Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 797++F47C 21 18 C9                         ld      hl,SWAP
 798++F47F 35                               dec     (hl)                    ; DEC SWAP               \ Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 799++F480 F1           LL124_6502:         pop     af                      ; PLA            SP+0    \ Restore Y from the stack so it gets preserved through
 800++F481 32 F6 F0                         ld      (Yreg),a                ; TAY                    \ the call to this subroutine
 801++F484 CD 17 F3                         call    LL146_6502              ; JMP LL146              \ Jump up to LL146 to move the low bytes of (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) into (X1, Y1) and (X2, Y2), and return from the subroutine with a successfully clipped line
 802++F487 C9                               ret                             ; then exit so we don't pop it twice
 803++F488 F1           LL137_6502:         pop     af                      ; PLA            SP+0    \ Restore Y from the stack so it gets preserved through
 804++F489 32 F6 F0                         ld      (Yreg),a                ; TAY                    \ the call to this subroutine
 805++F48C                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to indicate the clipped line does not fit on-screen
 805++F48C 37          >                        scf
 806++F48D C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 807++F48E                      ENDIF
# file closed: ././Layer2Graphics/BBCEliteDirectMappingLL118.asm
   9+ F48E
  10+ F48E              l2_drawHorzClipY:
  11+ F48E EB           .ClipY:                 ex      de,hl                       ; get X1 into de
  12+ F48F CB 7A        .ClipDE:                bit     7,d
  13+ F491 28 06                                jr      z,.DEPositive
  14+ F493 11 00 00     .DENegative:            ld      de,0
  15+ F496 C3 AC F4                             jp      .ClipDEDone
  16+ F499 7A           .DEPositive:            ld      a,d
  17+ F49A A7                                   and     a
  18+ F49B CA A4 F4                             jp      z,.ClipDE127
  19+ F49E 11 7F 00     .ClipDE256:             ld      de,127

  22+ F4A6 CA AC F4                             jp      z,.ClipDEDone
  23+ F4A9 11 7F 00                             ld      de,127
  24+ F4AC              .ClipDEDone:

  28+ F4B4 38 04                                jr      c,.AdjustEndY               ;
  29+ F4B6 ED 53 DF EE  .ClipStartY:            ld      (starty),de                 ; .

  31+ F4BD 7C           .InitEndY:              ld      a,h                         ;

  33+ F4BF FE FF                                cp      $FF                         ;
  34+ F4C1 28 05                                jr      z,.ForceEndYSet

  36+ F4C6 C8                                   ret     z
  37+ F4C7 D0                                   ret     nc
  38+ F4C8 ED 53 E1 EE  .ForceEndYSet:          ld      (endy),de

  49+ F4DF 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0

  67+ F508 30 01                                jr      nc,.x1ltex2

  76+ F51A ED 4B 97 F5  .x2Clipped:             ld      bc,(y1)
  77+ F51E 41                                   ld      b,c

  79+ F520 53                                   ld      d,e
  80+ F521 1E BF                                ld      e,$BF

  82+ F526
  83+ F526 CB 7A        l2_drawVertClipY:       bit     7,d                     ; i = (py1<0?0:py1);
  84+ F528 28 03                                jr      z,.PYIsOK
  85+ F52A 11 00 00     .SetPYTo0:              ld      de,0
  86+ F52D 2A DF EE     .PYIsOK:                ld      hl,(starty)
  87+ F530                                      IsHLEqu255
  87+ F530 7C          >                        ld      a,h
  87+ F531 A7          >                        and     a               ; if its non zero then it can't be 255
  87+ F532 C0          >                        ret     nz
  87+ F533 7D          >                        ld      a,l
  87+ F534 3C          >                        inc     a               ; if it was 255 the inc will set it to zero
  88+ F535 CA 40 F5                             jp      z,.UpdateStartY
  89+ F538 CD 3C 98                             call    CompareHLDESgn       ; or starty > py
  90+ F53B 30 03                                jr      nc,.UpdateStartY        ;
  91+ F53D C3 44 F5                             jp      .PrepareUpdateArray
  92+ F540 ED 53 DF EE  .UpdateStartY:          ld      (starty),de
  93+ F544              .PrepareUpdateArray:    JumpIfRegLTE c, 127, .UpdateCounters ; we loop from
  93+ F544 79          >                        ld      a,c
  93+ F545 FE 7F       >                        cp      127
  93+ F547 CA 53 F5    >                        jp	    z,.UpdateCounters
  93+ F54A DA 53 F5    >                        jp		c, .UpdateCounters
  94+ F54D 0E 7F                                ld      c,127
  95+ F54F ED 43 E1 EE  .UpdateEndY:            ld      (endy),bc               ; save BC to endy y as its now clamped, thsi frees up BC regsiters
  96+ F553 DD E5 E1     .UpdateCounters:        ld      hl,ix                   ; get target array index and set it to
  97+ F556 19                                   add     hl,de                   ; targetArray[de]
  98+ F557 19                                   add     hl,de                   ; .
  99+ F558 79                                   ld      a,c                     ; now set up B as an iterator
 100+ F559 90                                   sub     b                       ; for py2 - py1 + 1 entries
 101+ F55A 3C                                   inc     a                       ; .
 102+ F55B 47                                   ld      b,a                     ; .
 103+ F55C DD 54 DD 5D                          ld      de,ix                   ; we don't need de anymore to move ix for faster instructions
 104+ F560 73 23 72 2B  .UpdateArray:           ld      (hl),de                 ; use sjasm fake as it does (hl)=e,inc hl, (hl)=d,inc hl
 105+ F564 3C                                   inc     a                       ; use a as a counter for the end when we update EndY
 106+ F565 10 F9                                djnz    .UpdateArray            ; .
 107+ F567 C9                                   ret                             ; we are now done

 110+ F568
 111+ F568              ; ">l2_draw_any_line, bc = y0,x0 de=y1,x1,a=color: determines if its horizontal, vertical or diagonal then hands off the work"
 112+ F568              ; b - y0 c - x0, d - y1 e - x1 a - colour
 113+ F568 08           l2_draw_any_line:       ex		af,af'              ; save colour into a'
 114+ F569 79                                   ld		a,c                 ; if x and e are the same its horizontal
 115+ F56A BB                                   cp		e
 116+ F56B 28 08                                jr		z,.HorizontalLineCheck
 117+ F56D 78                                   ld		a,b                 ; if b and d are the same its vertica;
 118+ F56E BA                                   cp		d
 119+ F56F 28 0E                                jr		z,.VerticalLine
 120+ F571              ; use jp and get a free ret instruction optimisation
 121+ F571 08           .DiagonalLine:		    ex		af,af'			     ; get colour back into a
 122+ F572 C3 D6 E9                             jp		l2_draw_diagonal
 123+ F575
 124+ F575 78           .HorizontalLineCheck:   ld      a,b
 125+ F576 BA                                   cp      d
 126+ F577 28 0B                                jr      z, .SinglePixel
 127+ F579 08           .HorizontalLine:        ex		af,af'              ; get colour back into a
 128+ F57A 53                                   ld		d,e				    ; set d as target right pixel
 129+ F57B 5F                                   ld		e,a				    ; e holds colour on this call
 130+ F57C C3 BD E4                             jp		l2_draw_horz_line_to
 131+ F57F 08           .VerticalLine:          ex		af,af'
 132+ F580 5F                                   ld		e,a				    ; e holds colour on this call
 133+ F581 C3 55 E5                             jp		l2_draw_vert_line_to
 134+ F584 08           .SinglePixel:           ex		af,af'              ; get colour back into a
 135+ F585                                      l2_plot_macro; jp      l2_plot_pixel
 135+ F585 78          >                        ld      a,b
 135+ F586             >                        JumpIfAGTENusng 192 ,.NoPlot
 135+ F586 FE C0       >                        cp     192
 135+ F588 D2 94 F5    >                        jp		nc,.NoPlot
 135+ F58B 69          >                        ld      l,c
 135+ F58C CD 68 E0    >                        call    asm_l2_row_bank_select
 135+ F58F 67          >                        ld      h,a
 135+ F590 3A B5 E2    >                        ld      a,(line_gfx_colour)
 135+ F593 77          >                        ld      (hl),a
 135+ F594             >.NoPlot:
 136+ F594 C9                                   ret
 137+ F595              ;-*-*-;......................................................
 138+ F595              ;-*-*-; hl'hl = x1y1 de'de = x3y3 , does not save, just plots points
 139+ F595              ;-*-*-Layer2_draw_ClipY_Line:
 140+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       Eliminte totally off screen first
 141+ F595              ;-*-*-.Y1HighTest:            IsHLGT127                       ; if y1 and y2 > 127
 142+ F595              ;-*-*-                        jr      nz,.Y1HighLTE127        ; .
 143+ F595              ;-*-*-.Y2HighTest:            IsDEGT127                       ; .
 144+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ret     nz                       ;   return
 145+ F595              ;-*-*-.Y1HighLTE127:
 146+ F595              ;-*-*-.Y1LowTest:             bit     7,h                     ; if y1 and y2 < 0
 147+ F595              ;-*-*-                        jr      z,.YTestPass            ; .
 148+ F595              ;-*-*-                        bit     7,d                     ; .
 149+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ret     nz                      ;   return
 150+ F595              ;-*-*-.YTestPass:             exx                             ; hl hl' = x1y1 de de' = x2y2
 151+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      a,h                     ; if x1 and x2 < 0 or > 255
 152+ F595              ;-*-*-                        and     a                       ; then in either scenario high
 153+ F595              ;-*-*-                        jr      z,.XTestPass            ; byte will not be zero
 154+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      a,d                     ; .
 155+ F595              ;-*-*-                        and     a                       ; .
 156+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ret     nz                      ;   return
 157+ F595              ;-*-*-.XTestPass:                                             ;
 158+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       Check for horizontal and vertical exceptions
 159+ F595              ;-*-*-.CheckForVertical:      call    CompareHLDESigned       ; if x1 = x2 then vertical line
 160+ F595              ;-*-*-                        jp      z, l2_drawVertClipY     ;    goto vertical and use its ret as a free exit
 161+ F595              ;-*-*-.CheckForHorizontal:    exx                             ; hl'hl = x1y1 de'de = x2y2
 162+ F595              ;-*-*-                        call    CompareHLDESigned       ; if y1 = y2 then horizonal line
 163+ F595              ;-*-*-                        jp      z, l2_drawHorzClipY     ; goto  horizontal and use its ret as a free exit
 164+ F595              ;-*-*-                        exx                             ; hl hl' = x1y1 de de' = x2y2
 165+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       Now we can draw diagnoal, note we are pre-sorting Y so no need to do sort logic
 166+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       Check if X1 > X2 and set sign, X1 x2 and clip accordingly
 167+ F595              ;-*-*-.SetupMinMaxX:          call    CompareHLDESigned       ; If x1 > x2
 168+ F595              ;-*-*-                        jr      c, .x1LTx2              ; . (else jump to x1 < x2 as we have already handled x1 = x2)
 169+ F595              ;-*-*-.x1GTEx2:               ld      a,$FF                   ;   sign_x = -1 (also iyh)
 170+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (sign_x),a              ;   .
 171+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      iyh,a
 172+ F595              ;-*-*-                        NegHL                           ;   x1 = - x1
 173+ F595              ;-*-*-                        NegDE                           ;   x2 = - x2
 174+ F595              ;-*-*-                        xor     a                       ;   xmax = 0
 175+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmax),a           ;   .
 176+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmax+1),a         ;   .
 177+ F595              ;-*-*-                        inc     a                       ;   xmin = -255 ($FF01)
 178+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmin),a           ;   .
 179+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      a,$FF
 180+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmin+1),a         ;   .
 181+ F595              ;-*-*-                        jp      .DoneSignSetup          ; else
 182+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       if X1<X2 then set up sign as 1, clip, we don't need to change X1 and X2
 183+ F595              ;-*-*-.x1LTx2:                ld      a,1                     ;   sign_x = 1 (also iyh)
 184+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (sign_x),a              ;   .
 185+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      iyh,a                   ;   .
 186+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ZeroA                           ;   clip_xmin = 0
 187+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmin),a           ;   .
 188+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmin+1),a         ;   .
 189+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmax+1),a         ;   clip_xmax = 255
 190+ F595              ;-*-*-                        dec     a                       ;   .
 191+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (clip_xmax),a           ;   .
 192+ F595              ;-*-*-.DoneSignSetup:
 193+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       Set up Delta x = x2 - x1
 194+ F595              ;-*-*-.CalcDeltas:            ex      de,hl                   ; de = x1 hl = x2
 195+ F595              ;-*-*-                        push    hl                      ; save x2                       Stack+1
 196+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ClearCarryFlag                  ; delta_x = x2 - x1
 197+ F595              ;-*-*-                        sbc     hl,de                   ; .
 198+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (delta_x),hl            ; .
 199+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       Set up Delta X step
 200+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ClearCarryFlag                  ; multiply by 2
 201+ F595              ;-*-*-                        adc     hl,hl                   ; .
 202+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (delta_x_step),hl       ; delta_x_step = delta x * 2
 203+ F595              ;-*-*-                        pop     hl                      ; Restore X2                     Stack+0
 204+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ; now hl = x2 and de = x1
 205+ F595              ;-*-*-;                       Set up Delta y = y2 - y1
 206+ F595              ;-*-*-.CalcDeltaY:            exx                             ; hl = y1 de = y2, we don't save hl,de as we will load later
 207+ F595              ;-*-*-                        ld      (y1Work),hl             ; y1Work = y1
 208+ F595              ;-*-*-                        push    hl                      ; save y1 so that it can be loaded to HL later
